chapter.title: What is the Gentoo Cluster Project?

body.p: The Gentoo Cluster Project aims to make Gentoo a desirable platform for high-performance and high-availability clustering. The project will develop documentation and support for designing and implementing clusters. This will increase Gentoo's visibility in enterprise-level computing.

Notice: We are looking for new members, especially those experienced in high-availability clustering or filesystems. If you're interested and qualified, please contact tantive or spyderous via e-mail or IRC.
Please join us in IRC on freenode.net, #gentoo-cluster.
Adelie Linux has contributed to the high-performance subproject.
A demonstration of the power of Gentoo clusters was available for the duration of Linux World, Tuesday-Thursday August 5-7. An archive is at http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/cluster/demo-lwe.xml.

tr.ti: This subproject is developing documentation for and supporting high-performance clusters with the help of Adelie Linux.
This subproject is developing documentation for and preparing to support high-availability clusters.

body.p: Each person working on the Gentoo Cluster Project is listed here alphabetically. Full time indicates that their main Gentoo position is on this project, part time indicates that their main position lies in another area but they do additional work with this project.
To participate in the Gentoo Cluster Project, please contact spyderous via e-mail or IRC.
